organization.fullName: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

identificationModule.officialTitle: Effect of Aerobic Interval Training on NEAT in Sedentary Men

leadSponsor.name: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
It has been reported that obese individuals are seated 2 Â½ hour more than lean individuals and that non exercise thermo genesis (NEAT) may vary with as much as 2000 Kcal/day between equal size people due to different occupational and leisure time activities. The primary aim of the study is to investigate if 10 weeks of exercise training increase NEAT in sedentary men.

Subject will be randomized to three different training intervention, with 3 exercise session each week for 10 weeks. NEAT will be measured using an activity sensor and recorded over a 7 day period both before and after training.

armGroups.label: 4 x 4 Interval
armGroups.description: 4 x 4 minutes of high intensity intervals at 90-95% of maximal heart rate separated by 3 minutes of active brakes in between at 70% of maximal heart rate.

armGroups.label: 1 4 minutes interval
armGroups.description: 1 x 4 minutes intervals at 90-95% of HR max

interventions.name: 1 x 4 minute interval
interventions.description: 1 x 4 minutes of high intensity intervals at 90-95% of maximal heart rate

interventions.name: 4 x 4 minutes Intervals
interventions.description: 4 x 4 minutes of high intensity intervals at 90-95% of maximal heart rate separated by 3 minutes of active brakes in between at 70% of maximal heart rate.

primaryOutcomes.description: NEAT Will be measured using an activity sensor. Physical activity is recorded over a 7 day period. The energy equivalent of each of these activities is determined. The time spent in each activity is then multiplied by equivalent for the activity. The values are then summed to derive an estimate of NEAT.

secondaryOutcomes.description: The secondary aims are to investigate the changes in maximal oxygen uptake, heart function, and body composition in response to interval training

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Male gender
* Age 18-50
* BMI 25-30 kg x m2
* No significant comorbidities
* Abel to exercise
* Not partaking in organized physical activity

Exclusion Criteria:

* Inability to exercise due to musculoskeletal conditions
* Known ischemic cardiovascular disease
* High daily physical and occupational activity levels

references.citation: Zisko N, Stensvold D, Hordnes-Slagsvold K, Rognmo O, Nauman J, Wisloff U, Karlsen T. Effect of Change in VO2max on Daily Total Energy Expenditure in a Cohort of Norwegian Men: A Randomized Pilot Study. Open Cardiovasc Med J. 2015 Apr 30;9:50-7. doi: 10.2174/1874192401509010050. eCollection 2015.
